attributes.action: Should the EFL get more money for featuring on TV
attributes.additional_details:
Sky and BT will be paying the Premier League 4.46bn over the next 2 seasons. Where the EFL will get 595 million over the next 5 years. TV money in the EFL is far less than in the Premier League. Championship clubs chosen to host matches are awarded 100,000 per game- unless its played on Sunday(120,000) or Thursday(140,000) - while away teams collect a fixed fee of 10,000.
In contrast, the club which finished bottom of the Premier League last season, West Brom, banked an astonishing 12.3million
attributes.background:
There is a massive gap between the Premier League clubs
and what the EFL clubs get paid. 
"Pre year" Championship teams get 4% of what Premier League teams get. 
If the EFL got more money from TV rights this would help with FFP for most clubs.
